node.title: Ernie Dingo joins vaccination fight in bid to boost jab rates in WA Indigenous communities
node.alt: A head and shoulders shot of Ernie Dingo speaking during a media conference.
node.description: TV personality Ernie Dingo will drive from Perth to the Pilbara this week as part of a federal government campaign to boost vaccination rates among Indigenous communities in remote WA.
node.content:
["TV personality Ernie Dingo will drive from Perth to the Pilbara this week as part of a federal government campaign to boost vaccination rates among Indigenous communities in remote parts of Western Australia.", "Mr Dingo is set to leave Perth on Wednesday and drive with a TV crew to communities in the Pilbara, where Indigenous vaccination rates are among the worst in the country.", "During the campaign, he will meet elders\u00a0and engage in traditional yarning circles to break down mistrust and vaccine hesitancy.", "In the Pilbara, 19 per cent of the Indigenous population aged 16 and over have received their second vaccine dose, according to Federal Minister for Indigenous Australians Ken Wyatt.", "WA's inoculation figures continue to lag, with the Indigenous vaccination rate in WA sitting at 32 per cent second dose, compared to the national average of 58 per cent second dose for Indigenous people aged 16 and over.", "
'Need to speed things up': Dingo
", "Mr Wyatt said it was important to use every possible strategy to increase jab rates among Indigenous communities, in the lead-up to WA opening its border to the rest of the country when it reaches a vaccination rate of between 80 and 90 per cent.", "", "
Ken Wyatt (left) and Ernie Dingo held a media conference in Perth to announce the trip.(ABC News: Kenith Png)
", "\"If we're heading towards an 80 per cent mark for opening up WA, it's somewhere between 80 and 90\u00a0and we open up, that leaves our communities with low vaccination rates extremely vulnerable,\" he said.", "\"We have been looking at all of the strategies but the thing that works the most is when our communities have a trusted person, they can hear the story from about what the virus is, what vaccination does, then that changes the way in which they engage.\"", "Mr Dingo said he was working closely with the National Indigenous Australians Agency on the campaign, which would have a focus on spending meaningful time in community.", "\"It's a slow pace, when you sit down with the elders, you've got to sit through. You learn more by never asking a question.", "\"But in this case, we need to speed things up.\"", "
WA hits 70pc double-dose mark
", "The announcement of the campaign comes as\u00a0figures show 70.5 per cent of West Australians aged 16 and over have now received two vaccine doses.", "", "
WA's COVID-19 reopening roadmap
", "Mr Dingo is set to travel with a crew from Aboriginal story agency BushTV and arrive in the Hedland area on Friday before visiting communities in Karratha, Roebourne, Onslow, Tom Price, Paraburdoo and Newman.", "It is expected he will spend a month in the Pilbara and return again in January.", "It also comes as the Northern Territory recorded nine new COVID-19 cases overnight \u2014\u00a0all of whom are Aboriginal \u2014\u00a0bringing the total number of cases in its Katherine and Robinson River outbreak to 11."]
